Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Agile \Ag"ile\, a. [F. agile, L. agilis, fr. agere to move. See {Agent}.] Having the faculty of quick motion in the limbs; apt or ready to move; nimble; active; as, an agile boy; an agile tongue. [1913 Webster]
Shaking it with agile hand. --Cowper. [1913 Webster]
Syn: Active; alert; nimble; brisk; lively; quick. [1913 Webster]

agile adj 1: moving quickly and lightly; "sleek and agile as a gymnast"; "as nimble as a deer"; "nimble fingers"; "quick of foot"; "the old dog was so spry it was halfway up the stairs before we could stop it" [syn: {nimble}, {quick}, {spry}] 2: mentally quick; "an agile mind"; "nimble wits" [syn: {nimble}]
